description: Albania on March 16, 2020 enforced a curfew from 18:00 to 06:00.

Albania on April 25 declared that seniors can move freely from 6:00 am to 8:30 am only the in low risk towns of Diber and Gjirokaster along with the municipalities of Pogradec, Prrenjas, Librazhd, Saranda, Delvine, Himara, Konispol, Finiq, and Divjak. The policy starts on April 27th.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Albania is removing curfew restrictions in all parts of Albania starting on June 1st.

Albania is relaxing lockdown restrictions in low risk towns of Diber and Gjirokaster along with the municipalities of Pogradec, Prrenjas, Librazhd, Saranda, Himara, Konispol, Finiq, and Divjak starting on April 27th. Residents can move on foot and by car from 9:30AM until 5:30PM without authorization. UPDATE: Albania is relaxing lockdown restrictions in low risk areas of Albania.
Albania declared on the 9th of November that starting from Wednesday, November 11, 2020 a new curfew will be enforced. From 22:00 until 6:00 people are not allowed to move outside.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 24, 2020, Albanian government declared a state of emergency for 30 days.
Albania will extend the state of emergency until June 23rd. UPDATE: Albania will extend the state of emergency until June 23rd.
Albania closed the border with Greece for land and air travel on March 14th. UPDATE: All travel by land and air from Greece is now blocked.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
By October 2, 2020, "Republic of Kosovo" and "Republic of Albania" have signed a cooperation agreement in the field of health.
"This agreement will further deepen not only the cooperation but also the mutual exchange of experts and health personnel in order to support and clinical case management. Cooperation in the field of providing good medical practice and evidence for the treatment of patients with Covid19. Provision of health and public health services by doctors of both countries for border areas. Establishment of a common platform for information sharing in the context of epidemic surveillance. "Also, reciprocal actions in the framework of the epidemiological investigation, exchange of information for the citizens in both countries, of the cross-border areas, and mutual measures which will continue to be taken following the response to Covid19",
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Albania enforced a two day travel ban in the capital city of Tirana and between other cities in Albania. All private vehicles and public transportation was banned from Friday March 13th through Sunday midnight March 15th.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Albania on April 7 declared that it is enforcing a two-week quarantine on all Albanian citizens that wish to enter the country through land borders. These citizens must not be residents in other countries because if so they will not be allowed to enter Albania.

description: On May 8, 2020 Albania declared that it will enforce a two-week quarantine on all Albanian citizens that will be repatriated during the COVID-19 epidemic, starting from May 11, 2020. Violation of such policy will be punished. "Inspektoriati Shteteror Shendetesor" will monitor the implementation of this decision.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Albanian government has decided from 20 September 2020 to "Prohibits the opening of nightclubs, discos, lounge bars and any kind of service of this nature indoors or outdoors, except restaurants." Those who breaks the law will be fined with 3.000.000 lek (29000 USD) and "suspension of activity for a period of one year." Moreover, there will be the stop of the "music after 20.00 (8.00 pm) in all service facilities of any kind". Those who breaks the law will be fined with 1.000.000 lek (9700 USD) and "suspension of activity for a period of six months."
institution_status: This type of business ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with no conditions attached
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 11 november "there will be restrictions on movement from 22:00-6:00 until December 2. Exceptions are emergencies and reasons for work." Moreover, "there will be a restriction on fast food restaurants and bars from 22:00 to 6:00 in addition to the delivery service until December 2nd. Citizens will be provided with authorization in e-albania, except in cases when there are health emergencies or for health institutions and employees of critical services that are excluded from applying in e-Albania."

description: Albania canceled all sporting events, cultural events, and other large public gatherings until April 3rd, 2020.
Albania extended the ban on public gatherings that was set on March 8th indefinitely.

"The Albanian government" has decreed, on a national basis, "the mandatory use of protective fabric masks" in "every closed environment". The decree, imposed on all citizens, entered into force on July 15 and with a deadline to be set and a "penalty of 2,000 lek (20 USD) for each violation of the rule".
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all indoor spaces
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
